intro: Galium idubedae, commonly known as the Idubedan bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and swampy areas. Galium idubedae is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests, where it thrives in the humid and nutrient-rich environment.
